title: Authors and Citation
text: Csárdi G (2025). tsjson: Edit JSON Files. R package version 0.0.0.9000.
code: @Manual{,   title = {tsjson: Edit JSON Files},   author = {Gábor Csárdi},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

title: Edit JSON Files
text: Extract manipulate parts JSON files without touching formatting comments parts.

title: Edit JSON Files
text: can install development version tsjson GitHub :
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("gaborcsardi/tsjson")

title: Edit JSON Files
text: See https://gaborcsardi.github.io/tsjson/ also installed package: help(package = "tsjson").

title: Edit JSON Files
text: Create tsjson object string: Pretty print tsjson object:
code: txt <- r"( // this is a comment {   "a": {     "a1": [1, 2, 3],     // comment     "a2": "string"   },   "b": [     {       "b11": true,       "b12": false     },     {       "b21": false,       "b22": false     }   ] } )" json <- load_json(text = txt) json #> # json (19 lines) #>  1 |  #>  2 | // this is a comment #>  3 | { #>  4 |   "a": { #>  5 |     "a1": [1, 2, 3], #>  6 |     // comment #>  7 |     "a2": "string" #>  8 |   }, #>  9 |   "b": [ #> 10 |     { #> ℹ 9 more lines #> ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more lines

what: Select elements in a tsjson object
title: Edit JSON Files
text: Select element objects key: Select element inside element: Select element(s) array: Select multiple keys object:
code: select(json, "a") #> # json (19 lines, 1 selected element) #>    1  |  #>    2  | // this is a comment #>    3  | { #> >  4  |   "a": { #> >  5  |     "a1": [1, 2, 3], #> >  6  |     // comment #> >  7  |     "a2": "string" #> >  8  |   }, #>    9  |   "b": [ #>   10  |     { #>   11  |       "b11": true, #>   ... select(json, "a", "a1") #> # json (19 lines, 1 selected element) #>   2   | // this is a comment #>   3   | { #>   4   |   "a": { #> > 5   |     "a1": [1, 2, 3], #>   6   |     // comment #>   7   |     "a2": "string" #>   8   |   }, #>   ... select(json, "a", "a1", 1:2) #> # json (19 lines, 2 selected elements) #>   2   | // this is a comment #>   3   | { #>   4   |   "a": { #> > 5   |     "a1": [1, 2, 3], #>   6   |     // comment #>   7   |     "a2": "string" #>   8   |   }, #>   ... select(json, "a", c("a1", "a2")) #> # json (19 lines, 2 selected elements) #>    2  | // this is a comment #>    3  | { #>    4  |   "a": { #> >  5  |     "a1": [1, 2, 3], #>    6  |     // comment #> >  7  |     "a2": "string" #>    8  |   }, #>    9  |   "b": [ #>   10  |     { #>   ...

title: Edit JSON Files
code: select(json, "a", "a1") |> delete_selected() #> # json (18 lines) #>  1 |  #>  2 | // this is a comment #>  3 | { #>  4 |   "a": { #>  5 |     // comment #>  6 |     "a2": "string" #>  7 |   }, #>  8 |   "b": [ #>  9 |     { #> 10 |       "b11": true, #> ℹ 8 more lines #> ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more lines

title: Edit JSON Files
text: Insert element array: Inserting array reformats array. Insert element object, specified key:
code: select(json, "a", "a1") |> insert_into_selected(at = 2, "new") #> # json (24 lines) #>  1 |  #>  2 | // this is a comment #>  3 | { #>  4 |   "a": { #>  5 |     "a1": [ #>  6 |       1, #>  7 |       2, #>  8 |       "new", #>  9 |       3 #> 10 |     ], #> ℹ 14 more lines #> ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more lines select(json, "a") |>   insert_into_selected(key = "a0", at = 0, list("new", "element")) #> # json (27 lines) #>  1 |  #>  2 | // this is a comment #>  3 | { #>  4 |   "a": { #>  5 |     "a0": [ #>  6 |       "new", #>  7 |       "element" #>  8 |     ], #>  9 |     "a1": [ #> 10 |       1, #> ℹ 17 more lines #> ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more lines

title: Edit JSON Files
code: select(json, "a", c("a1", "a2")) |> update_selected("completely new") #> # json (19 lines) #>  1 |  #>  2 | // this is a comment #>  3 | { #>  4 |   "a": { #>  5 |     "a1": "completely new", #>  6 |     // comment #>  7 |     "a2": "completely new" #>  8 |   }, #>  9 |   "b": [ #> 10 |     { #> ℹ 9 more lines #> ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more lines

what: Insert a new element into the selected ones in a tsjson object — insert_into_selected
title: Insert a new element into the selected ones in a tsjson object — insert_into_selected
Insert a new element into the selected ones in a tsjson object — insert_into_selected
code: insert_into_selected(   json,   new,   key = NULL,   at = Inf,   format = c("auto", "pretty", "compact", "oneline") )

title: Insert a new element into the selected ones in a tsjson object — insert_into_selected
text: json tsjson object new New element insert. serialized serialize_json(). key Key new element, inserting object. position insert new element : 0: beginning, Inf: end, numbers: specified element. format Formatting new element, passed serialize_json().

title: Insert a new element into the selected ones in a tsjson object — insert_into_selected

what: Parse a JSON file or string into a tsjson object — load_json
title: Parse a JSON file or string into a tsjson object — load_json
Parse a JSON file or string into a tsjson object — load_json
code: load_json(file = NULL, text = NULL, ranges = NULL)

title: Parse a JSON file or string into a tsjson object — load_json
text: file Path JSON file. Use either file text. text JSON string. Use either file text. ranges Optionally list integer pairs defining ranges within file text parse.

title: Parse a JSON file or string into a tsjson object — load_json
Print a tsjson object — print.tsjson
text: Calls format.tsjson() format tsjson object, writes formatted object standard output, returns original object invisibly.

title: Run tree-sitter queries on a JSON file or string — query_json
text: file Path JSON file. Use either file text. text JSON string. Use either file text. query Character string, tree-sitter query run. ranges Optionally list integer pairs defining ranges within file text parse.

text: Create tsjson object string:   Pretty print tsjson object:
code: txt <- r"( // this is a comment {   "a": {     "a1": [1, 2, 3],     // comment     "a2": "string"   },   "b": [     {       "b11": true,       "b12": false     },     {       "b21": false,       "b22": false     }   ] } )" json <- load_json(text = txt) json #> # json (19 lines) #>  1 |  #>  2 | // this is a comment #>  3 | { #>  4 |   "a": { #>  5 |     "a1": [1, 2, 3], #>  6 |     // comment #>  7 |     "a2": "string" #>  8 |   }, #>  9 |   "b": [ #> 10 |     { #> ℹ 9 more lines #> ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more lines

what: Select elements in a tsjson object
title: tsjson quickstart — quickstart
text: Select element objects key:   Select element inside element:   Select element(s) array:   Select multiple keys object:

what: Serialize an R object to JSON — serialize_json
title: Serialize an R object to JSON — serialize_json
Serialize an R object to JSON — serialize_json
code: serialize_json(   obj,   file = NULL,   collapse = FALSE,   format = c("pretty", "compact", "oneline") )

title: Serialize an R object to JSON — serialize_json
text: obj R object serialize. file NULL result written file. collapse file NULL whether return character scalar character vector. format Formatting, one : "pretty": arrays objects formatted multiple lines, "compact": format everything without whitespace, "oneline": format everything without newlines, include whitespace commas, colons, opening brackets braces, closing brackets braces.

title: Serialize an R object to JSON — serialize_json
text: file NULL character scalar (collapse = TRUE) vector (collapse = FALSE). file NULL nothing.
